maml:description.maml:para: Add a Terminal-Icons color theme for the current user.
Add a Terminal-Icons color theme for the current user. The theme data is stored in the user's profile
The path to the Terminal-Icons color theme file.
Overwrite the color theme if it already exists in the profile.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
The literal path to the Terminal-Icons color theme file.
Overwrite the color theme if it already exists in the profile.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
The path to the Terminal-Icons color theme file.
The literal path to the Terminal-Icons color theme file.
Overwrite the color theme if it already exists in the profile.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

dev:type.maml:name: You can pipe a string that contains a path to 'Add-TerminalIconsColorTheme'.

maml:alert.maml:para: 'Add-TerminalIconsColorTheme' will not overwrite an existing theme by default. Add the -Force switch to overwrite.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Add the color theme contained in ./my_color_theme.psd1.
Add all color themes contained in the folder ./path/to/colorthemes and add them, overwriting existing ones if needed.

maml:description.maml:para: Add a Terminal-Icons icon theme for the current user.
Add a Terminal-Icons icon theme for the current user. The theme data is stored in the user's profile
The path to the Terminal-Icons icon theme file.
Overwrite the icon theme if it already exists in the profile.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
The literal path to the Terminal-Icons icon theme file.
Overwrite the icon theme if it already exists in the profile.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
The path to the Terminal-Icons icon theme file.
The literal path to the Terminal-Icons icon theme file.
Overwrite the icon theme if it already exists in the profile.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

dev:type.maml:name: You can pipe a string that contains a path to 'Add-TerminalIconsIconTheme'.

maml:alert.maml:para: 'Add-TerminalIconsIconTheme' will not overwrite an existing theme by default. Add the -Force switch to overwrite.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Add the icon theme contained in ./my_icon_theme.psd1.
Add all icon themes contained in the folder ./path/to/iconthemes and add them, overwriting existing ones if needed.

maml:description.maml:para: Prepend a custom icon (with color) to the provided file or folder object when displayed.
Take the provided file or folder object and look up the appropriate icon and color to display.
The file or folder to display
The file or folder to display

dev:type.maml:name: You can pipe an objects that derive from System.IO.FileSystemInfo (System.IO.DIrectoryInfo and System.IO.FileInfo) to 'Format-TerminalIcons'.
Outputs a colorized string with an icon prepended.

dev:remarks.maml:para: List a directory. Terminal-Icons will be invoked automatically for display.
Get a file object and pass directly to Format-TerminalIcons.

maml:description.maml:para: List the available color themes.
List the available color themes.

dev:type.maml:name: An array of hashtables representing available color themes.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get the list of available color themes.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the list of glyphs known to Terminal-Icons.
Gets a hashtable with the available glyph names and icons. Useful in creating a custom theme.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the table of glyph names and icons.

maml:description.maml:para: List the available icon themes.
List the available icon themes.

dev:type.maml:name: An array of hashtables representing available icon themes.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get the list of available icon themes.

maml:description.maml:para: Get the currently applied color and icon theme.
Get the currently applied color and icon theme.

dev:type.maml:name: An object representing the currently applied color and icon theme.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get the currently applied Terminal-Icons color and icon theme.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes a color or icon theme
Removes a given icon or color theme. In order to be removed, a theme must not be active.
The icon theme to remove.
The color theme to remove.
Bypass confirmation messages.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
The icon theme to remove.
The color theme to remove.
Bypass confirmation messages.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

dev:type.maml:name: The name of the color or icon theme to remove.

maml:alert.maml:para: A theme must not be active in order to be removed.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Removes the icon theme 'MyAwesomeTheme'
Removes the color theme 'MyAwesomeTheme'

maml:description.maml:para: Set the Terminal-Icons color theme.
Set the Terminal-Icons color theme to a registered theme.
The name of a registered color theme.
The name of a registered color theme.

dev:type.maml:name: The name of a registered color theme.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Set the color theme to 'devblackops'.

maml:description.maml:para: Set a specific icon in the current Terminal-Icons icon theme or allows swapping one glyph for another.
Set the Terminal-Icons icon for a specific file/directory or glyph to a named glyph.
Also allows all uses of a specific glyph to be replaced with a different glyph.
The well-known directory name to match for the icon.
The name of the glyph to use; or, when swapping glyphs, the name of the glyph you want to change.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Set README.md files to display a text file icon.
Set XML files to display an XML file icon.
Set directories named ".github" to display an Octocat face icon.
Changes all uses of the "nf-mdi-xml" double-wide glyph to be the "nf-mdi-file_xml" single-width XML file glyph.

maml:description.maml:para: List example directories and files to show the currently applied color and icon themes.
List example directories and files to show the currently applied color and icon themes. The directory/file objects show are in memory only, they are not written to the filesystem.
